alert.note: Alert for Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 03 at 2:16AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Montana, including the following counties, Big Horn, Carbon, Golden Valley, Musselshell, Park, Rosebud, Stillwater, Sweet Grass, Treasure, Wheatland and Yellowstone. Portions of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT today. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Stay alert! * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An additional quarter inch to one inch of rain is expected through this morning, with locally heavier amounts possible. Though showers will become lighter and less widespread, residual runoff from recent heavy rains may continue to pose a flooding risk through this morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
